meanings.definition: To continue in existence or operation for a specified time.
meanings.sent1: The movie lasted for two hours.
meanings.sent3: The battery lasted longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her patience lasted like a sturdy oak tree in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day lasted vividly in his mind.

meanings.definition: To remain in a particular state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The smile on her face lasted all day.
meanings.sent2: The warmth of the sun lasted until the clouds rolled in.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm lasted through the entire project.
meanings.sent4: The hope in her heart lasted through the darkest times.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers lasted in the air.

meanings.definition: To continue to be in good condition or to be usable.
meanings.sent1: The old watch lasted for generations.
meanings.sent2: The antique furniture lasted through many moves.
meanings.sent3: His favorite toy lasted longer than he expected.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them lasted like a timeless treasure.
meanings.sent5: The charm of the historic building lasted through the years.
